intro: Cypripedium barbatum var. grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered杓兰, is a rare and striking orchid native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white to pale purple flowers with a distinctive, recurved lip. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as forests and rocky slopes. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it produces a single, elongated stem with a few foliage leaves. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered a protected species in many regions.
